content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.178 - Executive order no. 178: establishing the temporary task force on health insurance for retired educational employees

State Regulations
WHEREAS, the costs of health care coverage have risen
sharply throughout the nation in recent years; WHEREAS, continued health insurance benefits for retirees
of educational institutions has long been of serious concern to the people and
government of New York State; WHEREAS, the national recession and subsequent sluggish
economic recovery have forced nearly all levels of government to take actions
to reduce or control expenditures; WHEREAS, a number of school districts have opted out of the

State Health Insurance Plan in order to obtain less expensive health insurance
coverage through private insurance carriers; WHEREAS, retirees increasingly face severe threats to their
financial security due to their former employers' cutbacks on the provision of
health insurance; and
WHEREAS, it is desirable to bring together the concerns of
local school districts, retirees of educational units and the citizens of New

York regarding the funding of continued health insurance coverage for retired
educational employees; NOW, THEREFORE, I, MARIO M. CUOMO, Governor of the State of

New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and Laws
of the State of New York, do hereby order as follows: I. Temporary Task Force on Health Insurance
for Retired Educational Employees

There is hereby created the Temporary Task Force on Health

Insurance for Retired Educational Employees. The Task Force shall consist of
five members appointed by the Governor, one of whom shall be appointed on the
recommendation of the Temporary President of the Senate and one of whom shall
be appointed on the recommendation of the Speaker of the Assembly. The Governor
will select the Chair from among the five members. Members of the Task Force
shall receive no compensation but shall be entitled to reimbursement for any
necessary expenses incurred in connection with the performance of their
duties. II. Powers and

Responsibilities of the Task Force

The Task Force shall examine issues relating to continued
health insurance coverage for retirees of local educational units, including
the merits and potential costs of providing such coverage. The Task Force shall make recommendations to the Governor
and the Legislature by May 31, 1994 on a policy and process for ensuring that
retiree benefits are treated equitably. III. Cooperation of State Agencies

All departments, divisions, boards, offices and public
corporations shall cooperate with and provide such assistance as may be
required for the Task Force to fulfill its obligations. Signed: Mario M. CuomoDated: December 7, 1993
WHEREAS, the Temporary Task Force on Health Insurance for

Retired Educational Employees was established by Executive Order Number 178 on

December 17, 1993 to examine issues relating to continued health insurance
coverage for retirees of local educational units, including the merits and
potential costs of providing such coverage; WHEREAS, Executive Order Number 178 required the Temporary

Task Force to issue recommendations to the Governor and the Legislature by May
31, 1994 on a policy and process for ensuring that retiree benefits are treated
equitably; WHEREAS, the Temporary Task Force has issued interim
recommendations on this matter, has provided good cause as to why completion of
the study and analysis will require additional time, and has requested an
extension in the deadline for the filing of its final findings and
recommendations; and
WHEREAS, it is in the best interest of the State that the
findings and recommendations of the Temporary Task Force be thorough and
complete; NOW, THEREFORE, I, MARIO M. CUOMO, Governor of the State of

New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and Laws
of the State of New York, do hereby continue Executive Order Number 178 dated

December 17, 1993, except that the second paragraph of Section II of
such

Executive Order is amended to read as follows: The Task Force shall make recommendations to the Governor
and the Legislature by December 1, 1994 on a policy and process for ensuring
that retiree benefits are treated equitably. Signed: Mario M. CuomoDated: August 9, 1994
